EastEnders actor Ben Hardy has given fans hope for a Peter Beale return almost two years after leaving Albert Square. 
The soap star quit the show in 2015, leaving viewers devastated as his character was written out following the revelation that young Bobby was behind the murder of Peter's twin sister Lucy. 
Speaking on ITV's Good Morning Britain, Ben admitted while there were no immediate plans for a big comeback, it wouldn't be something he'd rude out for the future. "Never say never" (Photo: ITV) 
"Never say never, who knows? Not in the imminent future," he said. Read More 
The actor - who will make his big BBC comeback in new period drama The Woman in White - also revealed that it can be difficult working in the high pressure environment of a soap. Could Peter Beale had back to Walford? (Photo: BBC) 
He added: "It’s such a hard craft, and you learn so much doing it because it’s just relentless. Read More 
"You’re doing 12 scenes a day. it’s so hard to get your best work out when you’re doing that kind of structure.” He quit the show in 2015 (Photo: BBC) 
Opening up about playing Walter Hartright in The Woman in White - adapted from Wilkie Collins' psychological thriller - Ben can't wait. 
"I have always admired and been a fan of the BBC's period drams and I'm so thrilled to be playing the leading role of Walter in this classic story," he said. Like us on Facebook
